intro: Racosperma gillii, commonly known as the Grey Box, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its grey, fissured bark and small, pinnate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by flat, bean-like pods. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species found in various regions of southern Australia. Racosperma gillii plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and stabilizing soils in its habitat.
